Row.Text: Muad'Dib aims to have a large standing army and likes other leaders of the same ilk. He dislikes civilizations who attack his home continent and hates suprise wars being declared upon him.

Your enemies secrets lay open before you, great Kwisatz Haderach of the Atriedes line. Your rule will become a legend for others to follow, hoping to measure up in some small way to the titanic figure you take within myth. In all corners of the empire, the name Paul Muad'Dib is never forgotten.

Your rule stands as an iron fist to the people of the empire, mighty child of Muad'Dib. While those after you will decry you as the Tyrant who rule for 3500 years, they will remain blissfully unaware that the millennia of misery you subjected your people to was the sole reason they survived, and resulted ultimately in an explosion of genetics in the Atriedes line that allowed them to free themselves from the bonds of fate and forge their own destiny.
-1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities from Luxury Resources. Upon researching chemistry, cities get +50% [ICON_Gold] Gold, +50% [ICON_Production] Production, and +1 [ICON_Amenities] Amenities
Unique Building unlocked after researching chemistry, grants +5 [ICON_Faith] and one Shaitan unit upon completion
Capital has +1 to all non-culture yields (+2 [ICON_Food] Food), and +1 [ICON_Housing] Housing. +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith and +1 [ICON_Science] Science from desert and desert hill tiles in the empire

Atriedes' Unique improvement, gives +1 [ICON_Culture] Culture, +1 [ICON_Faith] Faith, +1 [ICON_Food] Food, and +1 [ICON_Production] Production, as well as +2 [ICON_Housing] Housing. Can be constructed on desert/tundra or desert hill tiles once the Mining tech has been researched. Can be plundered for 150 [ICON_Faith] Faith.
4 levels of [ICON_VisLimited] Diplomatic Visibility more than normal with other civilizations met.
The Arrakeen fortress that Muad'Dib spent his days as emperor in, this building adds +1 to all non-culture yields (+2 [ICON_Food] Food).

A towering figure protruding from the earth, this idol fills those who view it with a profound sense of understanding for the world around them. +5 [ICON_Science] Science and +10% [ICON_Science] Science in this city
A shady figure whose face is obscured by a cowl, this idol elicits great fortune for those who control it. +5 [ICON_Gold] Gold and +10% [ICON_Gold] Gold in this city
A wise figure bending down to nurture wonder in those around him, this idol elicits awakens man's inner curiosity. +5 [ICON_Culture] Culture and +10% [ICON_Culture] Culture in this city

A pragmatic figure with a hunter's pack, this idol helps to prepare its masters for the harsh realities of the wilderness. +5 [ICON_Food] Food and +10% [ICON_Food] Food in this city. +1 [ICON_Food] Food from all tiles in this city
A stalwart figure alone among the trees, this idol helps gives man the strength to control his own destiny. +5 [ICON_Faith] Faith and +10% [ICON_Faith] Faith in this city
An enigmatic figure hunched over a fiery anvil, this idol provides what man most hungers for: power. +5 [ICON_Production] Production and +10% [ICON_Production] Production in this city

The Shrine to Muad'Dib is the Unique Building for the Atriedes, replacing the regular Shrine. It has all the features of the Shrine, but also grants +1 [ICON_Culture] and +2 Great General points per turn.
The Worm portion of Leto II's latent body, Shaitan is a unique unit with 150 [ICON_Strength] Combat strength, and can attack 3 times per turn. Granted upon completion of the Hwi Noree wonder only.
Shaitan is not slowed by hills

Muad'Dib's Unique unit, the Fedaykin Death Commando has +5 [ICON_Strength] Combat strength more than the Swordsman it replaces, and an additional +20 [ICON_Strength] Combat strength in friendly territory, as well as +1 Movement
The Fremen is the Atriedes's Unique Unit. It replaces the warrior and has +3 movement and ignores hill terrain when moving, as well as +10 [ICON_Strength] Combat Strength.

The Fremen are a hardy lot, having been given the short end of the stick when it comes to living condition. However, their hellish environment has toughened them into some of the most formidable and durable soldiers in the empire, and are feared even by the Padishah Emperor's infamous Sardaukar.

Fremen consider their faith, which became the worship of Paul Muad'Dib, to be of the utmost importance. Their fanatical devotion to him was extremely powerful, and was the reason that the Kwisats Haderach was able to seize control of the empire from the Padishah Emperor. Inside of their Sietchs in the desert, Fremen women and children are trained in survival in the desert, becoming both humble of their surroundings and deadly to those that would oppose them. In a Fremen household, every member is capable of killing an intruder.

Among the Fremen, a certain group is held above the rest. The Fedaykin, Paul's personal death commandos, were widely feared for their combat prowess, and for the fact that they were incorruptible, easily giving their lives in service to Muad'Dib. The secret to this fanatical service was the fact that the Fedaykin, along with all Fremen, considered Muad'Dib to be an actual god, and thus their servitude to him was divine and it meant nothing to sacrifice their lives for the sake of preserving his.
